item.title: Hibernate
item.description: Transaction isolation levels https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/transaction-isolation-levels-dbms/ A transaction isolation level is defined by the following phenomena – Dirty Read – A Dirty read is the situation when a transaction reads a data that has not yet been committed. For example, Let’s say transaction 1 updates a row and leaves it uncommitted, meanwhile, Transaction 2 reads the updated row. If transaction 1 rolls back the change, transaction 2 will have read data that is considered never to have existed.
